not provide undiscovered material.”73 Her remarks have proved prescient. If wehave succeeded in expanding Gilreath and Wilson’s reading of the catalogs, it isin part because we have adduced additional information from manuscripts in theAlbert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library at the University of Virginia and the Rare Books Division at the Library of Congress as well as in newly pub-lished Jefferson correspondence made available through Early Access documents and the Jefferson Papers project. As future bibliographers make additional dis-coveries about the University of Virginia’s library and develop new methodolo-gies—particularly around the interpretation of provenance evidence—we look forward to reading the yet unknown stories they have to tell.

Sowerby, Catalogue of the Library of Thomas Jefferson, xiv.
